CONTACT THE YMCA OF SOUTH FLORIDA
THE Y CALL CENTER
Have questions about membership and program offerings? Please contact our CALL CENTER during office hours.¬†For the fastest response, please complete the Contact Us form below.
At the YMCA of South Florida, we are committed to providing exceptional service and support to all our members and visitors. Whether you‚Äôre interested in joining our vibrant community, learning more about our diverse range of programs, or need assistance with your current membership, we‚Äôre here to help.
Our Membership Call Center is staffed with knowledgeable and friendly representatives who are ready to answer all your questions and guide you through our offerings.
CALL US
CONTACT US!

YMCA Nationwide Membership
Stay active, connected, and healthy‚Äîno matter where life takes you.
Access to more than 2,700 YMCAs in 10,000 communities
WHAT IS THE YMCA NATIONWIDE MEMBERSHIP?
Your YMCA Membership Travels With You
The
YMCA Nationwide Membership
lets you use your Y membership at participating YMCA locations outside of South Florida and across the United States‚Äî that‚Äôs more than
2,700 YMCAs in 10,000 communities
. Whether you‚Äôre traveling for work, visiting family, or exploring new cities, your fitness routine, community connection, and wellness journey don‚Äôt have to pause.
Your Y is part of a powerful movement for youth development, healthy living, and social responsibility‚Äîand now, that movement travels with you!
FIND A Y NATIONWIDE
Always Welcome. In Every Community.
No matter where you are, your Y is with you.
Convenience While Traveling
Stay on track with your wellness goals during work trips, vacations, and college visits.
Close to Home & Work
Access any nearby YMCA, whether it‚Äôs near your office or your kids‚Äô school.
More Ways to Move
Enjoy new classes, state-of-the-art fitness centers, and friendly faces across the country.
Community - Everywhere!
The Y isn‚Äôt just a gym. It‚Äôs a place where you belong‚Äîeven when you‚Äôre away from home.
FIND A Y NATIONWIDE
The YMCA Nationwide Membership is more than a perk‚Äîit‚Äôs part of our mission to make wellness, connection, and opportunity available to everyone, everywhere. Because when you belong to one Y, you belong to every Y.
YMCA NATIONWIDE MEMBERSHIP GUIDELINES
Everything You Need to Know
You must belong to a participating YMCA with an active, full-facility membership.
Must use your home Y at least 50% of the time.
Bring your membership card and photo ID when visiting another Y.
Sign a universal waiver and provide basic contact information.
Nationwide Membership does not apply to program-only or specialized memberships (like Silver Sneakers or group agency memberships).
Visiting for more than 28 days? You may need to transfer your membership to that Y.
Each Y may have unique class schedules or amenities‚Äîcheck ahead before visiting.
Program-only participants (including Silver Sneakers, Silver and Fit or otherlike programs) are not eligible for.
Nationwide Membership does not apply to program-only or specialized memberships (like Silver Sneakers or group / agency memberships).
Visiting for more than 28 days? You may need to transfer your membership to that Y.
Each Y may have unique class schedules or amenities‚Äîcheck ahead before visiting.
All Ys reserve the right to restrict or revoke these privileges.
Registered sex offenders are prohibited from participating.
FIND A Y NATIONWIDE

ABOUT YMCA OF SOUTH FLORIDA
A CENTURY OF SERVICE
For more than a century, the YMCA has been woven into the fabric of the South Florida community. As a leading nonprofit, the Y is committed to strengthening community through more than 200 programs serving everyone from six months old to 100 years young.
Our Family Centers and programs are inclusive, vibrant hubs of community life, offering a diverse array of classes, cutting-edge fitness facilities, life-saving aquatics, exciting community events, unforgettable camps, supportive afterschool care, and holistic health and wellness programming.
At the Y, there‚Äôs something for everyone.
FIND A YMCA
OUR MISSION
Our mission is to put Judeo-Christian principles into practice through programs that build healthy spirit, mind and body for all.
OUR
CAUSE
Strengthening communities is our cause.
That‚Äôs why, every day, we work side-by-side with our neighbors to make sure everyone, regardless of age, income or background, has the opportunity to learn, grow and thrive.
OUR FOCUS
All of the Y‚Äôs programs and services support three areas of focus, indicating WHY we do what we do.
YOUTH DEVELOPMENT
NURTURING THE POTENTIAL OF EVERY CHILD AND TEEN
We believe that all kids deserve the opportunity to discover who they are and what they can achieve. That‚Äôs why, through the Y, more youth today are cultivating the values, skills, and relationships that lead to positive behaviors, better health, and educational achievement.
HEALTHY LIVING
IMPROVING THE COMMUNITY‚ÄôS HEALTH AND WELL-BEING
In our community, the Y is a leading voice on health and well-being. With a mission centered on balance, the Y brings families closer together, encourages good health and fosters connections through fitness, sports, fun and shared interests. As a result, more youth, adults, and families are receiving the support, guidance, and resources needed to achieve greater health and well-being for their spirit, mind, and body.
SOCIAL RESPONSIBILITY
GIVING BACK AND PROVIDING SUPPORT TO OUR NEIGHBORS
Our Y has been listening and responding to our community‚Äôs most critical social needs for 100 years. Whether developing skills or emotional well-being through education and training, welcoming and connecting diverse demographic populations through community service, or preventing chronic disease and building healthier communities through collaborations with policymakers, the Y fosters the care and respect all people need and deserve. Through our Y, hundreds of volunteers and donors, leaders and partners are empowering thousands of people in South Florida to be healthy, confident, connected and secure.

Always Here for You!

ABOUT YMCA SOUTH FLORIDA'S FAMILY SUPPORT SERVICES‚Äã
WELCOME TO FAMILY SUPPORT SERVICES
We understand how challenging it can be to navigate public benefits and find the support your family needs. That‚Äôs why we‚Äôre here‚Äîto make the process easier and connect you to the resources that can make a difference.
The Family Support Services Program, funded by The Children‚Äôs Trust of Miami-Dade, provides personalized assistance to families across Miami-Dade County. Whether you need help applying for public benefits, accessing affordable childcare, or managing renewals, our team is here to support you every step of the way.
ü´∂
Caring Experts
Our trained Family Resource Advocates provide compassionate, personalized support to ensure your success.
üîë
Convenient Access
Services are available at YMCA locations, community centers, or virtually for your convenience.
üìä
Proven Impact
We help thousands of families every year access critical benefits and resources.

FAMILY SERVICES WE PROVIDE
HOW CAN WE HELP
Our program is designed to meet the unique needs of every family. We can assist you with:
Accessing Public Benefits
We provide one-on-one guidance to help you apply for and maintain benefits, including:

‚ù± Healthcare:

‚ù± Childcare:

‚ù± Housing Support:

‚ù± And more!
All Public Benefits we can help you apply for are listed in the Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ) section at the bottom of this page.

Who qualifies for these services?
Our services are designed for families in Miami-Dade County who need help accessing public benefits, including those with children, seniors, and individuals facing economic challenge
What does it cost?
All services provided through the Family Support Services Program are
FREE OF CHARGE.
Do I need an appointment?
Yes, many of our services, including tax preparation, require an appointment. You can schedule yours online or by contacting us.
How long does it take to receive help?
Our team will work quickly to address your needs. The timeline depends on the type of assistance required, but we‚Äôll keep you informed every step of the way.

VICTORY BLACK BOX THEATRE EVENTS
ABOUT EVENTS AT THE VICTORY BLACK BOX THEATRE
ARTS. CULTURE. INCLUSIVITY.
Step into the vibrant world of creativity at the Victory Black Box Theatre, nestled within the LA LEE YMCA / Mizell Community Center!
This dynamic space celebrates diversity and inclusivity, providing a platform for Black artists and artists of all backgrounds to showcase their talents and share their stories with the world. From thought-provoking dramas to soul-stirring performances, every production reflects the rich tapestry of the Black experience.
Join us in celebrating the power of art, culture, and community at the Victory Black Box Theatre, a place where everyone‚Äôs voice is heard and valued.

As a sponsor, you‚Äôll support a dynamic space dedicated to celebrating diversity and inclusivity, providing a platform for Black artists and artists of all backgrounds to shine. VICTORY BLACK BOX THEATRE AMBASSADORS
BECOME AN AMBASSADOR
In line with our commitment to fostering creativity and community engagement, the YMCA of South Florida is thrilled to announce a call for applications for the first cohort of Victory Black Box Theatre (VBBT) Ambassadors!
We invite passionate artists from all disciplines to join us as VBBT Ambassadors, embodying the transformative power of artistic expression and actively connecting with our community through the arts. Through their ambassadorship, these leaders will champion creativity, engage with the public, and collaborate with the Victory Black Box Theatre and its partners in the Sistrunk community.
Apply today to make a lasting impact through the Victory Black Box Theatre!

ABOUT THE YMCA SWIM TEAM
DIVE INTO THE WORLD OF LIFE-SAVING SPORTS
Swimming at a competitive level, no matter the age, is a fun and low-impact way to exercise with peers. Our program is broken up into two tracks: Y Swim League, and Swim Club. Swimmers new to the‚ÄØcompetitive environment of the sport typically begin in the Y Swim League. As youth and teen swimmers perfect their techniques, they may progress to a more challenging level.
SWIM LEAGUE
SWIM TEAM (BARRACUDAS)
ADULT SWIMMING
ABOUT THE Y SWIM LEAGUE
BEGINNER SWIM TEAM
The Y Swim League is a beginner swim team program that builds upon the skills participants learned in the YMCA of South Florida‚Äôs swim lesson program. Y Swim League team members learn the basic techniques of all four strokes in addition to developing race strategies and team camaraderie.
REQUIREMENTS
- Ages 7-17 (Kindergarten ‚Äì High School)
- 50 yards of Front Crawl with (side) rotary breathing
- 50 yards of backstroke
- Understanding of breaststroke and butterfly
COMMITMENT
- Practice 2-3 days per week
- Attend monthly Y swim meets (COMING SOON)
- Water time: 50-75 minutes (3-4x per week); days/times vary by location
Y Swim League Tryouts
Youth athletes are invited to put their skills to the test in our free, 15-30-minute Y Swim League tryout! Email your location to set up a day and time.
Hollywood YMCA
Angelique Gaither
[email¬†protected]
Weston YMCA
Lee Brennan, Development Lead Coach
[email¬†protected]
LEARN MORE
ABOUT SWIM CLUB
SWIM WITH THE BARRACUDAS
Our Club Team is a year-round competitive program which includes a USA Swimming component on top of our YMCA Swimming component. Within our Club team, we have three divisions:
‚Äì
Development
| Bronze and Silver swimmers (typically 10 & under)
‚Äì
Age Group
| Gold and Champs swimmers (typically 11-14);
‚Äì
Senior |
Senior, Sectional, and Junior National swimmers (typically high school aged swimmers)
REQUIREMENTS
- Ages 7-18
- Ability to legally swim all four strokes: Fly, Back, Breast, and Free plus additional group specifics.
- Must be a YMCA of South Florida member and registered with USA Swimming
COMMITMENT
- Attend YMCA and USA Swimming meets
- Swim practices
- Dry land practice - all club training group athletes participate in strength, mobility, body awareness, and mental training sessions.
Join the YSF Barracuda‚Äôs Swim Club
Questions? Please email
[email¬†protected]
or visit ysfswimming.org for more information.
LEARN MORE
ABOUT ADULT SWIM TEAM
MASTERS SWIM TEAM
The word ‚ÄúMasters‚Äù has nothing to do with your skill level or current ability in the pool; just your age. Masters Swimming is open to adults 18 and older who want to improve their fitness through swimming or who want to prepare to compete in a fun and social environment. We welcome all types of recreational swimmers, triathletes, competitive swimmers, and open-water swimmers to enjoy the camaraderie of our Masters Swim Team.
Each workout is coached by a certified YMCA of South Florida Swim Coach who will provide tips, feedback, and a friendly face to welcome you to our YMCA of South Florida Swim Family!
OVERVIEW
Masters Swim coaches lead workouts and help swim team members improve technique and endurance. Most team members do choose to enjoy competitions and coaches help swimmers train for those competitions. We do hold a United States Masters Swimming Club Membership for members interested but it is not required.
REQUIREMENTS
- Ages 18+
- $64 for members and $99 for non-members
- 50-75 minutes per practice (schedules vary by location)
- Must be able to swim 50 yards of Backstroke and Freestyle
